intro: Utricularia foveolata, commonly known as the bladderworts, is a carnivorous plant species belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like traps that capture and digest small aquatic organisms. This plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor environments such as bogs, marshes, and shallow water bodies. Its leaves are often submerged, while its flowering stems rise above the water surface. Utricularia foveolata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by controlling populations of microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling.
